name: Appleby Manor Country House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed on an offer which included 2 nights accommodation, dinner on the first night and breakfast both mornings a gingerbread tea and a cruise on one of the lakes.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was very friendly and helpful and took us along the corridor to our room, pointing out the restaurant and (small) swimming pool on the way. We didn't use the pool area which was quite small but had a jacuzzi and steam rooms in the same area.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a twin room (so it wasn't one of the fancy bathrooms with the tv) - but the room was a good size and the bathroom was also nice and clean with a good shower over the bath.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the restaurant the first night which was lovely - we were able to choose from 3 starters and main courses as part of our deal (but they would have been our choices from the menu anyway!) - food arrived really quickly and was piping hot. There is a good wine list, and there are also recommendations on the menu to compliment your meal which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Brilliant,!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable, but the room was quite hot overnight even with the heating turned off, and with us being in a garden room on the ground floor with patio doors, we couldn't open a window to let a bit of air through.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from an amazing two night break at the Appleby Manor Hotel. The weather was terrific as was the hotel. Excellent food, accomodation, and service. Set in a fantastic location. We shall defininetly be back!
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a one night break last Saturday night at the Appleby Manor, the first visit we have made. When we arrived at the hotel we were given a short tour of the downstairs then to our room, which was lovely. We went for the DBB package that included afternoon tea and a boat trip on lake windermere, we also upgraded to a deluxe room which had an amazing bathroom complete with tv and jacuzzi bath. The food, service and staff were all great and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly if you're looking for a relaxing break. The only bad thing about the trip was having to come home!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel, Friendly staff & great rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Made a last minute booking so got the last room in the hotel. It was a very small room in the annexe but was beautifully appointed and had a large modern bathroom. We also got a welcome back tray with complimentary mineral water and homemade biscuits even though it is nearly 6 years since our last visit. The staff, as ever are courteous,efficient and friendly and do everything to put you at your ease.
reviews.title: Peace and quiet, exemplary service, wonderful food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is excellent - lots of homemade speciailities and this hotel has the best breakfast menu I have ever seen.
reviews.title: Lovely Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will certainly be returning a lot sooner than 6 years.
reviews.title: unpretentious luxury in a true Manor House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here on a special 2 night break with 6 friends and had a great time. The hotel is lovely- very comfortable with plenty of seating areas and lovely views from the conservatory and dining room. We atyed in the coach house which unfortunately did not have nice views, close to road, but were clean and adequate.
reviews.title: Excellent time- great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best things about the hotel are it`s staff who were all so friendly and really seemed to enjoy their work- which makes a pleasant change from a lot of hotels. Service was excellent and very quick- the food was excellent. The breakfast was cooked to perfection and used top quality ingredients.
reviews.title: Fantastic way to spend your wedding anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Would highly recommend- we ate at the Royal Oak on the second night and the food there was exceptionally good- but book if you are going on a Saturday night as it gets packed.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Great food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the owners and the staff, we thank you all
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a beautiful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Gordon and Kathleen have had a ball
reviews.title: An Hotel that maintains a very high standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our Valantine night stay at Appleby Manor. We stayed via the winter special break, which included a bottle of wine, ginger bread tea, 5 course gourmet meal overnight stay and breakfast. The meal was exceptional, with lots of choice. We had been told that the portions were small but did not find this at all.
reviews.title: Excellent stay and great deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a superior room which was a nice suprise, which gave us a seating area, jacuzzi and over bath tv. Our free bottle of wine was waiting for us in the room nicely gift wrapped.
reviews.title: superb experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a small swimming pool which requires you to swim in a circle or it was not big enough to swim. There is also a hot tub, steam room and sauna. This leisure amenity was an additional perk to the hotel, which added to our enjoyment.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were very helpful and pleasant and seemed happy working at the hotel.
reviews.title: We had a good deal...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we will definately be returning to the hotel soon, while the offer is still on. We therefore highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Idyllic setting, amazing food & fantastic whisky!

description: Appleby Manor is a true Lake District country house hotel, set in half a million acres of some of the loveliest countryside in England. Appleby Manor is surrounded and protected by the magnificent mountains and fells of the Lake District, North Pennines and Yorkshire Dales. The hotel accommodation offers the perfect surroundings to relax. Sit back and enjoy open log fires, a fine selection of wines and whiskies together with an award-winning restaurant, excellent hotel bedrooms and superb views over the Eden Valley.
